data.text: Traffic along Enugu-Onitsha Expressway is moving slowly after an early morning armed robbery scare. No casualties reported.
Reports of a kidnapping near Udi are under investigation. Preliminary findings suggest it was a traffic jam mistaken for abduction.
The Aba–Owerri accident involved 1 tricycle and 1 minibus. 2 persons sustained minor injuries. Road partially cleared.
Our men responded to a fire outbreak near Abakaliki express caused by a tanker spill. Fire contained, no fatalities.
Enugu State Government confirms New Market road reopened after last night’s tanker fire. Commuters may now pass freely.
At Ihiala junction, a truck spilled petrol. Drivers warned to avoid scooping fuel as safety teams move in.
We confirm accident on Aba–Owerri express. Contrary to rumors, no deaths recorded. 4 persons treated at nearby clinic.
Following clashes near Abakaliki road, security has been reinforced. Travelers are advised to use alternate routes.
Work is ongoing at Nnewi–Nkpor road to address flooding damage. Expect diversions during repairs.
Movement along Nsukka–9th Mile is free. No checkpoints mounted today. #TrafficUpdate
Contrary to online reports, no armed robbery took place on Enugu–Onitsha road. Scene was cleared after a vehicle broke down.
Our union reports soldiers still collecting bribes at Ugwuoba checkpoint. We have lodged formal complaints to the authorities.
Traffic on Aba express has eased. Both lanes reopened, tow truck removed wreckage successfully.
No casualties in Onitsha tanker fire contrary to exaggerated reports. Three shops were affected.
We urge citizens to disregard fake reports of multiple deaths on Aba–Owerri express. Official record is 0 fatalities.
Crash on Abakaliki road caused by reckless driving. We advise commuters to remain cautious.
There was no kidnapping on Enugu–PH road yesterday. Social media exaggerated. It was routine stop-and-search.
2 injured persons from yesterday’s Abakaliki clash receiving treatment. No deaths recorded.
Drivers are advised to avoid Oba junction until tanker spill is cleared completely. Movement is restricted.
Enugu–Makurdi road currently free of obstruction. No incidents reported this morning.
We confirm one market stall destroyed in Onitsha fuel spill fire. No life lost.
Government engineers deployed to repair collapsed section of Nnewi–Nkpor road after heavy flooding.
Casualty figures circulating online about Aba express crash are false. Only 2 minor injuries confirmed.
Armed robbery reports from last night were unfounded. It was a breakdown misinterpreted.
We advise drivers to exercise caution. Aba–Owerri corridor is dangerous due to repeated accidents.
We confirm that tanker fire near New Market was caused by brake failure, not sabotage as claimed online.
There was a minor clash between farmers and herders. Situation under control. Roads reopened.
Rescue teams attended quickly to Aba express victims. Situation exaggerated on social media.
Traffic flow improved at Onitsha head bridge after removal of broken trucks. Expect normal movement.
We caution citizens against spreading fake death tolls. Verified incidents are always communicated through official channels.
